title: Lopping off the heads of French quote - situation

content.description: “And what would the reader say, were I to tell him of a Member of Congress, who wished to see one of these murderous machines employed for lopping off the heads of the French, permanent in the State-house yard of the city of Philadelphia?”
content.question: The 1796 letter to a Philadelphia newspaper quoted above refers to which of the following?

choices.label: The Democratic-Republicans’ opposition to the Alien and Sedition Acts
The Federalists’ failure to counter political opposition
The Democratic-Republicans’ condemnations of John Adams’ administration
The Democratic-Republicans’ enthusiasm for the French Revolution

content.answer: The Democratic-Republicans’ enthusiasm for the French Revolution
